alert.note: Alert for Southeast Greene (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 5:18PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Greene County through 715 PM EDT... At 618 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles east of Parrottsville, or 10 miles southwest of Greeneville, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
